# Latex 

Fração

$$
\frac{1}{2}
$$

Sobrescrito

$$
Y = X_1 + X_2
$$

Potências

$$
a^2 + b^2 = c^2
$$


Raízes

$$
\sqrt{p}
$$
ou 


$$
\sqrt[3]{p^2}
$$
Fórmula de Bhaskara

$$
x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}
$$  


Binômio de Newton


\begin{equation} 
  f\left(k\right) = \binom{n}{k} p^k\left(1-p\right)^{n-k}
\end{equation} 



Pedaço da minha tese 


\begin{align}
\overline{u}_{i,j}^{n+\frac{1}{2}}= \overline{\overline{u}}_{i,j}^{n} + \delta t ( \theta_{i,j}^{n} L_{h} \overline{\overline{u}}_{i,j}^{n} +\theta_{i,j}^{n+\frac{1}{2}} L_{h} \overline{u}_{i,j}^{n+\frac{1}{2}} ); \nonumber \\
u_{i,j}^{n+1}= \overline{u}_{i,j}^{n+\frac{1}{2}} + \delta t ( \theta_{i,j}^{n+\frac{1}{2}} L_{h} \overline{u}_{i,j}^{n+\frac{1}{2}} +\theta_{i,j}^{n+1} L_{h} u_{i,j}^{n+1} ),
\end{align}

onde,

\begin{eqnarray}
\theta_{i,j}^{n}  =
\begin{cases}
1  \text{ , se } (n+i+j) \text{ é ímpar,} \\
0  \text{ , se } (n+i+j) \text{ é par,} 
\end{cases}
\end{eqnarray}

Com,

\begin{align}
(\overline{x}_{i}^{n+\frac{1}{2}},\overline{y}_{i}^{n+\frac{1}{2}}) & = (x_{i}-v_{1} \delta t , y_{j}-v_{2} \delta t)  \text{, e  } \nonumber \\ (\overline{\overline{x}}_{i}^{n},\overline{\overline{y}}_{i}^{n}) &= (x_{i}-2v_{1} \delta t , y_{j}-2 v_{2} \delta t)  
\end{align}
